In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

This function takes a string and an optional argument `text_width` which defaults to 10. It then splits the input string into words, and for each word it checks if adding this word would exceed the maximum width. If so, it adds a newline character. If not, it simply adds a space. The final result is returned as a string.

Let's see an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test of wrapping text", 10))
```

The output will be:

```
This is a 
test of 
wrapping 
text
```
